page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: Our area lies to the south west of Dartmoor and includes Bovey Tracey, Hennock, and Hawkmoor.Bovey Tracey is a small town. About 4000 people live here. Our mayor in 1985 is Mrs A. Warren.Some of Bovey Tracey's houses are council houses.In the town there are lots of shops and houses.There are 8 pubs in the town.There is 1 park in Bovey.Hennock is quite an old village. There used to be a mine in Hennock.The mine started in 1906 they dug for silver ore it was used for silver paint on battle ships. Hawkmoor hospital in the western corner of our area it is a hospital for the mentally handicapped and employs quite a few people. Most of the land in our area is used for farming.There are a couple of woods wich are owned by the Woodland Trust.Parke, a National Trust property is H.Q for Dartmoor Nat.Park.
